Move-in date can be flexible, please feel free to contact me and discuss.AreaSteps from bustling Oxford Street and the bright lights of Soho is Fitzrovia, a central London neighbourhood that seamlessly blends work with play, with restaurants and boutiques sitting comfortably next to thriving corporations. A mix of Edwardian and Neoclassical buildings characterise the neighbourhoodâs leafy streets, adding to its exclusive feel, but make no mistake:Fitzrovia has a friendly vibe. Surrounding the landscaped gardens, the apartments are carefully designed with top quality materials and refined clay brickwork to perfectly complement Fitzroviaâs strong architectural heritage. This prestigious development breathes new life into the already vibrant area, presenting an opportunity for anyone looking for a modern home in central Londonâs loveliest pocket.RestaurauntsLondonâs restaurant scene is second-to-none, and at the heart of it is Fitzrovia. Appealing to international tastes and styles, the areaâs cosy gastropubs, innovative restaurants and romantically-lit cocktail bars attract Londonâs fashionable crowd. On the other side of the building,development, residents can find the new and hugely popular italian restauraunt, Circolo Popolare. Indeed, in Fitzrovia and nearby Soho, thereâs everything from Venetian tapas at Polpo, to the fluffy steamed Taiwanese buns at Bao. Salt Yard has long been a favourite among fans of authentic Mediterranean cuisine: a mouth-wateringly good Spanish tapas menu features courgette flowers stuffed with goatâs cheese and drizzled with honey. For more taste sensations, indulge in the Peruvian cuisine craze thatâs taken London by storm. Both Lima and Pisqu serve almost-too-pretty-to-eat dishes among Inca-patterned cushions. Fresh flavours and the punch of a Pisco Sour will transport you to 01. Bao, Lexington Street South America.Artisan businessesJust outside the elegant the apartment is an array of characterful cafÃ©s, buzzing with London life. Walk in to the aroma of freshly ground coffee beans and oven-baked pastries at Tap No.26 â the perfect spot for Saturday morning catch-ups. Moments away is Fernandez & Wells, set in a stunning 1930s brick building. On the menu are made-to-order sandwiches and vitamin-packed salads, as well as draught beer on tap. Around the corner, Charlotte Street Hotel charms customers with its low-key luxe dÃ©cor. Famed across London, their Afternoon Tea includes melt-in-themouth raspberry and coconut cupcakes, and irresistible orange macaroons with chocolate ganache. A more recent opening includes the highly rated boutique Japenese coffee chain Omotesando Koffee, which is situated just outside the front door of the building.Shopping/Culture/ArtSurrounding the apartment are Londonâs most notable shopping streets. Boasting big brands and stylish department stores, Oxford Street is Londonâs main shopping artery. Argyll Streetâs world-famous Liberty store displays the best ofBritish fashion and dÃ©cor â from original silk prints to designer homeware. Meanwhile, Soho buzzes with artistic activity. Among its innovative art institutions is Frith Street Gallery, representing contemporary artists in different media,from painting to performance. Nearby, the bright lights of Londonâs West End dazzle theatre-goers every night of the week.Among Londonâs star attractions is The British Museum, covering over two million years of human history. People come from far and wide to catch a glimpse of world treasures such as the Rosetta Stone or the Egyptian mummies, yet itâs just 10 minutes away.Outdoor/ParksResidents have easy access to Londonâs loveliest parks. An emerald oasis in the heart of London, Regentâs Parkâs 395 acres include the rose-scented Queen Maryâs Gardens, a picturesque boating lake, an outdoor sports area, and ZSL London Zoo. Itâs also where youâll find the magical Open Air Theatre, hosting award-winning productions on starry summer nights.Closer still is Soho Square â a historic patch of green behind Oxford Street with a mock-Tudor building at its heart. Itâs a perfect place for a tranquil lunch break on the manicured lawn, or a quiet moment before or after work.

title: 1 Bed Flat, Guilford Street, WC1N
description: Fantastic 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom flat with small balcony from living room, in a great location. The apartment has just been redecorated and is very clean & fresh.The apartment features large double glazed windows throughout.The living room has floor to ceiling windows and opens onto a small balcony.The entire apartment has a lovely bright and open aspect.The modern oak flooring and solid oak furniture creates a feeling of calm.The living room features a smart looking sofa bed, a circular oak and glass table and a TV on an ultra adjustable bracket so it can be viewed from the sofa, table or kitchen.The view from the living room is very open and encompasses the trees of Coram's Fields and the attractive architecture of the University post graduate accommodation. The bedroom now includes 2 matching solid oak double wardrobes and large solid oak chest of drawers providing plenty of storage.The oak bed is king sized and designed to allow underbed storage of suitcases etc.The bathroom includes a large walk in shower. The amount of furniture can flexed in accordance with the tenants wishes.The fully fitted units in the kitchen include a dishwasher, fridge with freezer compartment, microwave and washer/dryer. The apartment is located on the 3rd floor, with lift.The apartment is quiet and the bedroom at the rear very quiet indeed.There are many delightful garden squares around the apartment - Coram's Fields, Brunswick Square Gardens, Russell Square, St George's gardens, Tavistock Square.Within 5 minutes walk are the fashionable eateries and shops of Lamb's Conduit Street.Also within 5 minutes walk is the Brunswick Centre with a wide variety of restaurants, shops, a large Waitrose and a Cinema.Russell Square tube is about 5 minutes walk and Kings Cross about 12 minutes walk.It is a very pleasant walk of about 15 minutes through Russell Square and past the British museum to Covent Garden.There is a gym within 2 minutes walk and public tennis courts are 7 minutes walk. Public swimming pool (indoor and outdoor) 15 minutes walk. The nearest Santander bike hire docking station is 3 minutes walk as is Costa coffee.The area is considered very safe comprising a large number of exclusive properties around garden squares and students that are fortunate enough to afford accommodation in the very heart of London.

title: 2 Bed Maisonette, Colnbrook Street, SE1
description: An outstanding Grade II Listed two bedroom maisonette. Set in SE1, this location is excellent, with close proximity to London Bridge and Southbank. The location offers superb transport links and a fantastic selection of local amenities in the surrounding area. ColnbrookStreet is between St Georges Road and London Road, which is just off Gladstone Street. This location has always beenpopular, however now even more so, with the SE1 regeneration happening on its doorstep. DESCRIPTIONUpon entry, the reception room on the left has lovely wooden flooring, a cast iron radiator, high ceilings and a large sashwindow with shutters overlooking the street. The ornate fireplace with marble surround acts as a focal point for theroom. Both sides of the fireplace have fitted alcoves with shelving and there are bi-folding doors leading into the kitchenarea. The kitchen also has high ceilings with cornicing, wooden flooring and plenty of space for a large dining table and chairs.The work surfaces are made from composite stone and you will also find all the latest appliances including an oven, gashob, microwave, dishwasher, sink and an inset fridge and freezer. There are views of the garden below vialarge sash windows. The bathroom is also on the raised ground floor and is situated at the rear of the flat. Here there is awet room, separate bath, extractor fan, heated towel rail and frosted sash windows. The hallway provides under stairstorage, great for neatly tucking away various household goods. Up a flight of stairs to the half landing, there is access to a south-east facing roof terrace, which is ideal for al-frescodining or simply to enjoy a morning coffee. The two bedrooms are located on the first floor. Bedroom one has two large sash windows with shutters, woodenflooring, a fireplace with fitted alcoves to each side, built-in storage and plenty of space for a double bed. Bedroom twohas built-in shelving, space for a double bed and delightful views of the garden below. Here you also have plenty of roomfor storage.DIRECTIONS Elephant & Castle Stations (Zone 1/2) (National Rail, Northern & Bakerloo Line) is approximately 0.4 miles away.Waterloo Stations (National Rail, Northern, Bakerloo, Waterloo & City & Jubilee Line) are approximately 0.6 miles away.The area is also well served by a frequent bus service into Central London and beyond and a number of SantanderDocking Stations can also be found close by.Furnishing: The tenants can have the choice of full furnishing, however this will increase the rent slightly per month.

description: A spacious and modern three double-bedroom maisonette in a prime location with excellent transport links.An ideal choice for a group of 3 students and professionals seeking a comfortable and convenient home.Two spacious double bedrooms, each equipped with a comfortable double bed, desk, chair, and ample storage space in full-wall wardrobes.The living room has been converted into a large third bedroom, complete with a cozy double bed, wardrobe, table, chair, and armchair.No shared living room, providing privacy and individual space for each tenant.Modern kitchen with integrated appliances including fridge, freezer, oven, and electric hobs.Laundry facilities (washing machine and dryer) are conveniently located in a kitchen cupboard.Recently refurbished in 2019, the property is offered fully furnished.Electric heating and boiler -- No gas bills.Excellent transportation links! Tucked away from any main road but only minutes walking distance from Euston Station, this spacious, two-bedroom, two-bathroom, fully furnished property has been completely renovated and features high-quality fittings, furniture and high-tech equipment. Following its conversion from former pub to luxury living accommodation, the entire building now comprises 2 maisonettes (inc this one) and 3 flats on the upper floors. This maisonette has its own direct access to street level and benefits from a video intercom system and CCTV. The front door leads into a bright sun drenched stunning L shaped living space furnished with luxurious sofas, a concrete dining table and a fully integrated kitchen with Siemens appliances (fridge/freezer, gas hob, electric oven and dishwasher). As this area formed part of the former pub, its exceptionally high ceilings (now fitted with Q Acoustic speakers) make this space feel light and airy. Double glazed hardwood windows have been fitted with electric blinds to provide additional privacy. The property has been fitted with engineered wood floor and underfloor heating throughout.A wood and glass LED-lit staircase takes you down to the lower level where the former lightwells of the pub have been converted into private courtyards which bring in plenty of natural light to the bedrooms. A purpose built cupboard in the hallway houses a Siemens washer/dryer.The main bedroom is furnished with a King-size bed and a luxurious 1200-sprung mattress. To compliment the space there is a solid oak wardrobe, chest of drawers and 2 bedside cabinets. Two doors provide access to the courtyards located at the front and side of the building and have been fitted with electric, bluetooth operated blackout blinds which you can set to wake you up via your phone.In the corner of the main bedroom is a spacious en-suite with walk-in rain shower, sink, wall-mounted WC and heated towel rail. It benefits from underfloor heating and mood lighting.The second bedroom is furnished with a copper-framed double bed, 1200 sprung mattress, chest of drawers and bedside table with its own direct access to one of the outside courtyards also fitted with the same electric blackout blinds. A full height walk-in wardrobe offers plenty of hanging space and shelf space. As the master bedroom has its own en suite, the second bedroom has sole use of the main bathroom which has been fitted with a bath / shower over bath, wall mounted WC and electric towel rail. This maisonette is located 6 minutes walk from Euston station, 2 minutes from Mornington Crescent and 10 minutes to Camden so has amazing central connections whilst benefiting from being set back from the hustle and bustle of the Euston Road and Eversholt Street in a quiet neighbourhood.

title: 3 Bed Terraced House, Hanover Gardens, SE11
description: Georgian Grade II listed home located in one of the areas most sought after squares, moments from Oval Underground station.The lower ground floor offers an impressive kitchen/dining room with solid oak worktops and a full range of smeg appliances (washer/dryer, dishwasher, fridge/freezer, stainless steel range cooker with double oven and 5 gas burner) and island with Butler sink and breakfast bar seating area. There is also a stunning shower room with copper fittings & exposed brickwork feature wall.On the raised ground floor is a 22ft double reception room with exposed floorboards, Georgian coving and skirting, feature fireplace, cast iron radiators, wooden sash windows with original shutters and antique brass fittings throughout. The first floor has a huge master bedroom again with the same Georgian features including another feature fireplace. On the same level is the main bathroom with both an oversized walk-in shower and cast iron roll top tub with high-end Burlington fittings throughout. The top floor has two further bedrooms both with the same level of finish and plenty of storage space within the eaves and above the stairs. Rare to the area, the property has an 80ft garden with patio seating and further decked area at the rear - a real sun-trap in the summer months. Parking is on-street with residents permitsHanover Gardens is moments away from Oval Underground (Northern line) as well as Surrey County Cricket Ground,the lovely Kennington Park and the highly regarded weekly farmers market, as well as numerous deli's and local amenities.Available now following redecoration works.

description: SummarySpacious, quiet, 20th (top) floor one bedroom flat in a fantastic central London location! The area has many health clubs, 24 hour supermarkets, restaurants, pubs, clubs, cinemas, theatres, libraries and well, everything one could want.Also around in the neighbourhood are the beautiful and tranquil Regentâs Canal and the world famous Bunhill Cemetery (whose residents include Daniel Defoe, William Blake, Thomas Hardy, to name a few).Getting aroundThe flat is under 100 metres from Old Street station (Zone 1).  Liverpool Street (Zone 1) and Farringdon (Zone 1) stations are under 1 mile away. Kings Cross & St Pancras and London Bridge stations are 1.5 miles away, as are St Paulâs Cathedral, Tower of London and the Monument. The flat is also served by numerous north-south as well as east-west 24 hour buses (bus stops just a 2 min walk away).Amenities & ExtrasFully furnished, fully stocked kitchen, powerful shower, insulated double paned windows and much more. Concierge. You can also get space in our external storage room in an adjacent building. Scooter parking is available but you will need to take a permit from the council. Car Parking may be available as well (will need to check with the council)Other NotesWe are looking for easy going tenants who are able to take care of minor things themselves. The rent has been set at a shade below market price for that reason.

title: 2 Bed Flat, Trocette Mansions, SE1
description: Furnished 2-bed, 2-bath flat including allocated parking space. Superbly located for tube and city on fashionable Bermondsey Street, discover the epitome of city living in this fully furnished, modern and bright apartment. Situated on one of the most sought-after streets in London Bridge, this stunning 2-Double Bedroom, 2-Bathroom first floor apartment is set within a secure gated private development backing onto the new Bermondsey Square with its restaurants, art-house cinema, farmers market and supermarket.   Key Features: Â·       Allocated car parking space included Â·       Two double bedrooms with new wood effect flooring, ample fitted wardrobes and ceiling fans Â·       Master bedroom with en-suite bathroom and charming garden views Â·       Second bedroom facing the peaceful communal gardens Â·       Two contemporary bathrooms, one with a bath and the other with a shower Â·       Generously sized reception and dining area with wood flooring and large triple glazed windows providing abundant natural light Â·       Fully-fitted modern separate kitchen with dishwasher, washing machine, and convection oven Â·       New 50-inch flat screen TV on a swivel wall mount Â·       Secure gated development  Â·       Alarm and video entry system for added security   Location: Nestled within a private development, this apartment backs onto the vibrant Bermondsey Square, offering an array of amenities right at your doorstep. title: 2 Bed Maisonette, The Old Rectory, SE1
description: Two double bed maisonette in The Old Rectory with own private cottage garden in Bermondsey Street, London Bridge SE1One professional or a professional couple of clean and tidy non smoker(s) required for a great fully furnished flat in much sought after street. This is a two double bedroom, fully furnished split level maisonette flat in a beautiful Georgian Rectory with its own private cottage garden. Flats here rarely come available to rent. All rooms have high ceilings, with gas central heating throughout. On the ground floor are two double bedrooms: both fully furnished with built in wardrobes. One, with window shutters for privacy, looks on Bermondsey Street, whilst the other has a view of the walled cottage garden below. (A rare amenity in this street which has been a godsend during lock down ). Sandwiched between these light and airy bedrooms is a bathroom with its own power shower and an original cast iron roll top bath. The stairwell leads down to an open plan living room with a decorative fireplace/dining area and a fitted kitchen. The kitchen has a gas hob, electric oven and white goods. Two small adjoining storage areas house a large freezer, cleaning equipment and a safe. The living room glass double doors lead up into the flat's cottage garden with lawn.This split level flat is the second largest unit within the Georgian Rectory, located in the old antique quarter of trendy/much sought after Bermondsey Street. This property is wired for SKY. new combi boiler installed June 2023.The flat is walking distance to shops, supermarkets, hairdressers, pubs and amazing restaurants/coffee/sandwich shops and bars, The White Cube, a cinema and free communal tennis courts. title: 3 Bed Flat, Darfield, NW1
description: This spacious three double bedroom split level flat is situated in a well-maintained and secure building. It offers the convenience of being located very close to Camden Town Underground Station, providing easy access to the Northern Line for seamless transportation.Key features of the flat include:- The accommodation is offered furnished, providing convenience for the tenants.- The flat features a fully equipped kitchen/diner, complete with a washing machine, allowing for comfortable and efficient meal preparation and dining.- A separate living room is included, providing a dedicated space for relaxation and entertainment.- The flat boasts a large bathroom with a shower, offering convenience for the tenants. Additionally, there is a second WC (water closet) available.- The location of the flat is particularly advantageous for students, as it is conveniently positioned for excellent bus routes to major universities, including St Martins Art School, SOAS (School of Oriental and African Studies), LSE (London School of Economics), UCLH (University College London Hospital), and the Veterinary School.- Gas and heating costs are included, relieving the tenants of the additional financial burden of these utilities.Considering its spacious layout, proximity to Camden Town Underground Station, fully equipped kitchen/diner, and convenience for students, early viewing of this flat is recommended to secure the opportunity.LocationThe flat is located in the vibrant area of Camden/Mornington Crescent. Camden is known for its lively atmosphere, bustling markets, and vibrant music scene. Mornington Crescent is a nearby neighborhood that offers a mix of residential and commercial spaces. Here's what you can expect from the location:- Proximity to Camden Town Underground Station (Northern Line) provides easy access to other parts of London, making commuting and exploring the city convenient.- Camden Market, one of London's most famous markets, is nearby. It offers a wide range of stalls selling fashion, art, food, and more, attracting both locals and tourists.- The area is known for its live music venues, including iconic venues like The Roundhouse, Electric Ballroom, and Jazz Cafe. These venues often host performances by renowned artists and emerging talents.- There are numerous dining options available, ranging from street food stalls to international cuisines and trendy restaurants. Camden is particularly famous for its diverse culinary scene.- The neighborhood has a rich cultural heritage and is known for its alternative and artistic atmosphere. It often attracts creative individuals, making it a vibrant and diverse community.- With excellent transport links and proximity to major universities, the location is particularly convenient for students attending institutions such as St Martins Art School, SOAS, LSE, UCLH, and the Veterinary School.Living in the Camden/Mornington Crescent area offers the advantage of being in a dynamic and culturally rich neighborhood with easy access to transportation, entertainment, dining, and educational institutions.

title: 2 Bed Flat, Lancaster Gate, W2
description: An immaculately presented split-level apartment set in an impressive mansion block on the highly desirable Lancaster Gate.  This generously proportioned abode is entered via the second floor, with accommodation arranged over the third and fourth (top) floors. On the third floor we are greeted by a stylish and spacious open-plan kitchen/reception room, featuring a peninsula island, contemporary dÃ©cor, large windows bathing the room in natural light and an ultra-modern glass staircase leading upwards. The fourth floor is home to two ample bedrooms, both with built-in wardrobes, the larger bedroom benefitting from an en suite bath and shower room with his and hers washbasins, the other from an en suite shower room, an additional, separate WC can be found off the landing, along with further storage.The aspirational Lancaster Gate is ideally situated adjacent to the vast green spaces of Hyde Park and within easy reach of the extensive shopping, restaurants and recreational facilities at Marble Arch, Knightsbridge and Notting Hill. Lancaster Gate Station (Underground - Central) is within a very short walk while Paddington Station offers access to a number of different lines (National Rail, Underground - Bakerloo, Circle, District and Hammersmith & City). Bayswater (Underground - District, Circle) and Queensway (Underground - Central) stations are also nearby. Available 8th SeptemberOffered furnishedEPC - B 81Council Tax - Band F (Westminster City)Security Deposit - Â£4,557.69 (equivalent to 5 weeks' rent)

title: 1 Bed Flat, Forbes House, W2
description: **Virtual video available upon request**A charming, homely and well-presented 1 bedroom Georgian 1st floor property with original stucco frontage, suitable for 1 or 2 professionals which has recently been freshly painted, benefits from high original ceilings, top grade appliances, and new wooden flooring throughout. The communal areas of the building have also recently been refurbished, including installing a new lift.The apartment  benefits from a south-west facing balcony, receiving great amounts of sunshine throughout the day, you can see Hyde Park while watching fantastic sunsets.The accommodation consists of an open plan kitchen / living room, separate bedroom both with double doors leading out to the balcony. The apartment is great for relaxing or entertaining. The kitchen has stone benchtops and is fully equipped with a full size integrated fridge / freezer and washer/dryer.The apartment is in a beautiful, historical building situated equally between Lancaster Gate tube (central line) and Paddington station. There are excellent transport links in and around London on your doorstep but also Paddington station has direct access to Heathrow with a 15 minute express train. Just down the road from Hyde Park and Kensington gardens for those who love running (about 8kms around). Walking distance to trendy Nottinghill, Knightsbridge, Regent and Carnaby Street, Bayswater and Edgeware Road.It is also very well served by excellent restaurants, cafes, bars, parks (and playgrounds), leisure and shopping facilities all within close proximity of the property. Virgin Active Mayfair is just at Marble Arch, Life Centre and Hotpod Yoga Nottinghill, Barrecore Nottinghill also just a short walk. Having lived in the apartment until having children, the landlord can also share lots of local recommendations for things to do and restaurants / bars. This apartment would suit someone who likes to wonder the streets of London shopping and visiting cafes but who also likes to come home to a lovely place that really feels like home.

title: Room in a Shared Flat, Boundary Lane, SE17
description: COUPLES WELCOME! Large, bright âEnsuiteâ Double Room to rent in a superb âVery High Spec and Exquisitely Elegantâ 2 Bedroom 2 Bathroom Flat share (part of a larger 'professionals preferred' House share) for a very clean and tidy, considerate, sociable, respectful, and 'professional' couple or person. You'd share the apartment with just one other person (who will have use of his / her own bathroom). No Agents please! Â£1,795 / mth, incl. ALL BILLS, Free Wi-Fi, Mood Lighting and Bi-Monthly cleaner, etc, extra free! Deposit & References are essential! Fyi, this offer is primarily for couples who wish to reduce their costs and bills associated with renting Studio and 1 Bed Apartments, etc, and whoâd also like to live in âprofessionals preferredâ Shared Accommodationâ¦which isnât always possible for âprofessionalâ couples in todayâs rental market (youâd share the kitchen / diner & lounge only with 1 other person) where ALL BILLS, etc, are included in the price! However, this room is also for a single person who's looking for a larger 'Ensuite' Bedroom in a shared 2 bedroom 2 bathroom apartment (same price).    Please note: the current uploaded images are just illustrative examples only of what your room / flat will look like when the painting & decorating, etc, is complete in a few daysâ time. Fyi, newer / more representative photos of your room / flat will be uploaded shortly. So, after many months of extensive refurbishment and upgrades, the flat is now open for viewings if you'd like to see it.   Please also note: If you smoke, vape, drink heavily and / or take (or deal) drugs then please look elsewhere!   FYI, THERE ARE NO AGENCY ADMIN, CONTRACT RENEWAL, TENANCY AGREEMENT DRAFTING FEES & COMMISSIONS, ETC, TO PAYâ¦THE LANDLORD PROVIDES THESE SERVICES, WHERE REQUIRED, FREE OF CHARGE!   Just off the Walworth Road in central London. Minutesâ walk to Elephant & Castle (zone 1/2), Camberwell and / or Kennington. An incredible choice of buses to all areas of London (only 5 minutes âapprox.â by bus to Elephant and Castle, in one direction, or to Camberwell, in the other)!   KEY FEATURES & BENEFITS OF YOUR TENANCY:    All bills are included!     Couples Welcome!     (Very Recently) Fully Furnished, Modernised and Exquisitely High Spec Accommodation with Top Quality Fixtures & Fittings throughout.     Your Bedroom comes with an 'Ensuite Bathroom'.     Amazing Mood Lighting options throughout*.     Property EPC Rating = C.     6 months minimum or 1-year minimum Fixed Tenancy Agreement Terms available.     No Tenant Guarantor required (by the Landlord)!     Bi-Monthly Cleaner (Your Bathroom and Communal Areas of your Flat)*.     High Speed Wi-Fi*.     Smart TV in the Lounge.     'Boosted' Multi-Function Grohe Power Showers, including Rainfall Shower, in your Bathroom.      'Optional' Japanese (or similar) style toilet seat bidet with touch sensitive controls for your Bathroom*.     Smart Lock(s) / Key-Free access to The Property & to your Bedroom, etc.     (Goodwill) Household Provisions*.     'Fast Turnaround' Repairs & Maintenance*.     'Pedal' Bicycle Storage.     Backyard Garden Patio area.    THE HOUSE / PROPERTY:   Newly refurbished, upgraded and modernised to a very high spec with a tastefully designed mix of ultra-modern, contemporary and a hint of traditional 'Victorian era' decor, features, furniture, conveniences, and appliances, etc. This House is warm, attractive, and extremely inviting. Beautifully bright and well maintained with light, neutral paint colours and tones in all the rooms, communal areas, and passageways, with the addition of hardwearing oak-effect laminate flooring throughout. It is a peaceful oasis in a vibrant Central London, with all the craziness and culture this international city can offer, national and international connections at your fingertips, a very comfortable home with generally friendly housematesâ¦happy days!   THE BEDROOM:   A Large Double âEnsuiteâ Room for rent in a superb Flat-Share (located within a beautiful 3 storey Victorian-style House-Share that accommodates more people in other Flats on other floors (with whom you can also socialise if you wish). An extremely beautiful and serene space with two large windows, hard wearing oak-effect laminate flooring throughout, two newly installed warm radiators, very comfortable double bed, two large wardrobes, large chest of drawers, workspace desk & chair, bedside table(s) and, of course, your very own Ensuite Bathroom (Couples Welcome!).   THE BATHROOM:   A highly attractive and exquisitely decorated modern and relaxing space with Geberit, Grohe and Victoria Plum, etc, fixtures and fittings, where a Japanese (or similar) style toilet seat bidet / washlet with touch sensitive controls is 'an option' for installation later on* (t.b.c.). The bathroom also comes with very handy additional fixtures & fittings such as a Shaving Point, Towel Rack, Soap and Shampoo Holder, Mirrors with lights, lots of Storage and Rainfall & Multi-Function Grohe (or similar) Power Showers!   THE KITCHEN / DINER:   Ultra-modern 'Magnet' kitchen with integrated appliances and dining area with table and chairs. Nearly all the modern appliances are made by Beko and include the following: full size dishwasher and washer dryer, large 50/50 fridge freezer (t.b.c.), electric double oven with induction hob, microwave, toaster, kettle, and storage, etc.   TOP QUALITY MODERN PORCELAIN TILES:   A stylish mix of interwoven eclectic glass mosaics adorn the kitchen and bathroom walls.   THE LOUNGE:   Along with the kitchen and dining area, the lounge in your apartment is shared with just 1 other person and is furnished with a double seat sofa, armchair, coffee table, bookshelves and a recently purchased wall-hung Smart T.V (t.b.c.).   FLOORING:   There's a good mix of newly installed Best Quality Real Oak Wood effect & Hard Waring Laminate Flooring throughout. However, your Bathroom Floor is tiled with porcelain.   COMMUNAL PASSAGEWAYS, ETC:   All the Communal Passageways, Staircases and Landings in the property are well lit, well located and immaculate (t.b.c.).   MOOD LIGHTING (INCL. STRIP LIGHTS)*:    Incredibly Beautiful and Colourful, Controllable, Variable and Available throughout your Accommodation Space(s) / Apartment*.   DOUBLE GLAZING & INSULATION:   Your bedroom windows are double glazed (to reduce sound and preserve heat), with trickle vents for added ventilation.    All the outward-facing walls in The Property, and under the floorboards, where appropriate, have been fully insulated with high-quality materials.    UPGRADED ELECTRICS & PLUMBING:   Completely renewed, updated and / or upgraded Cabling, Electrical Consumer Unit & Alarm Box, 'fully wired & connected' Smoke, Heat and Carbon Monoxide Alarms where appropriate, and an all-new Plumbing and (Gas) Central Heating System, etc, throughout!   âFULLY WIREDâ INTERNET / BROADBAND:   âFully wired' internet jack points and cabling to the router for a more stable connection to the Internet...not just via Wi-Fi*! Ready for 5G (and beyond) and FTTP (Fibre to the premises) (t.b.c.).   HIGH SPEED WI-FI*:   At least 100Mbps download throughout the property* (t.b.c.).   SMART LOCK(S) / KEY-FREE ACCESS, ETC:   To the property, and to your room(s) (t.b.c.), via the very latest in 'Yaleâ Smart Lock technologies. NB: instead of keys, you'll use tags, cards, your mobile phone and / or pin codes (t.b.c.).   Soft Close doors throughout (t.b.c.).   Other useful door furniture (t.b.c.).   BI-MONTHLY CLEANER:   For your Bathroom and Communal Areas*.   (GOODWILL) HOUSEHOLD PROVISIONS*:   Such as: Calgon Tablets (for the Washer / Dryer), Dishwasher Tablets, Toilet Paper, some Cleaning Supplies and Light Bulbs*   âFAST TURNAROUNDâ REPAIRS & MAINTENANCE*:   As and when required.   âPEDALâ BICYCLE STORAGE:   Safe parking (in the Backyard Garden Patio Area at the back of The Property) for your âpedalâ bicycle(s). Please note however: E-Bikes and E-Scooters, etc, are NOT allowed on / in The Property! Sorry about that.   BACKYARD GARDEN PATIO:   Beautifully designed Garden Patio Area at the back of The Property, for communal use by ALL Tenants, with Decking, Plants, Flowers and a few Cafe-Style Tables and Chairs, etc (t.b.c.).   CCTV CAMERAS / MONITORING*:    For enhanced safety and security for ALL Tenants as well as for The Property* (t. b. c.)!    PLEASE NOTE (1): * (asterisk) = The Wi-Fi / Broadband, CCTV cameras / monitoring, Bi-Monthly Cleaner, (Goodwill) Household Provisions, Mood Lighting (esp. the Strip Lights), 'Optional' Japanese (or similar) style toilet seat bidet / washlet with touch sensitive controls and Fast Turnaround Repairs & Maintenance are NOT INCLUDED in the rent you pay! They are just additional services and provisions, provided as a goodwill gesture and as often and as regularly as he can, by your Landlord 'Free of Charge' and for your benefit!   PLEASE NOTE (2): (t.b.c.) = these items will be available for you either just before or soon after you move in.   PLEASE NOTE (3): the Council Tax Band for this property is E.   THE LOCAL AREA:   Overall, this area is quite safe, quiet and an up-and-coming place to be. It is home to a plethora of cultures and peoples from all over the U. K. and from around the world, which makes it a much more interesting environment to live in than was previously the case (say 5 â 10 years ago).   And, there is a multitude of newly opened shops, bars, restaurants, gyms, markets and places of entertainment, etc, close by (some of them open 24 hours) all the way from the property to the newly developed Elephant & Castle area in one direction,  and to the fast developing Camberwell area in the other, providing you with an abundant supply of places to go and things to see and do in the local area â day or night!   Markets: East Street market is the closest. You can find some amazing bargains here. Other markets not so far away include Borough market, Lower Marsh Food Market, Bermondsey Square Farmers and Antiques Markets, Oval Farmersâ Market, and the New Covent Garden Flower Market(s) are all close byâ¦between 5 and 15 minutes on the bus, approximately.    Parks: Burgess Park (one of the largest in Southeast London) is just around the corner (1 â 2 minutesâ walk), and Kennington Park is about 5 â 10 minutesâ walk awayâ¦so quite close too. Burgess Park has a big lake for boating and fishing, an internationally recognised BMX bike racing track, a Tennis Centre, a Preserved Woodland area, an Adventure area (for both children and adults), Football areas, Public Barbecue zones, large entertainment spaces for concerts, circuses and fairs, and an Outdoor Gym, etc, etc!   Shopping, Entertainment & The Arts: within 10 â 20 minutes by bus and / or tube, you will find yourself in the heart of many of Londonâs historic and cultural landmarks. Regent Street, Oxford Street, Knightsbridge, Kensington (for The Natural History and V & A Museums, etc), Hyde Park (for the many festivals and shows, etc, throughout the yearâ¦including The Winter Wonderland around Christmas time), The Tower of London, The South Bank Centre, including The Hayward Gallery, The National Theatre and Royal Festival Hall are also close by, as are the IMAX cinema at Waterloo, the National Film Museum, Shakespeareâs Globe, The Imperial War Museum, The Tate Modern, Trafalgar Square, Buckingham Palace, The Royal Opera House and The Coliseum, Covent Garden and Theatre & Film Land around Leicester Square, on the Strand as well as on Shaftsbury Avenue, etc, in the West Endâ¦ and letâs not forget the City of Londonâ¦the financial heart (and brain) of the U. K.! I could go onâ¦   Sport: A Gym, just 3 â 5 minutesâ walk away on the Walworth Road, and now also at the NEW Elephant & Castle Leisure Centre (12 â 15 minutesâ walk away), are open 24 hours. Thereâs very cheap (sometimes freeâ¦) swimming as well at Camberwell Leisure Centre (just 12 - 15 minutesâ walk in the other direction - towards Camberwell Green). Thereâs also a Rock-Climbing wall at Vauxhall (under the railway arches) as well as, of course, the world famous Oval Cricket Ground close by (between Vauxhall, Kennington and Camberwell).   More about The Elephant & Castle (just 12 â 15 minutesâ walk away): FYI, over the next few years, the Elephant & Castle will become London's most exciting new neighbourhood in a Â£1.5bn transformation that will evolve and enhance its identity. It will very soon become known as âthe place to beâ rather than just âa place to pass throughâ.   Already a lively London neighbourhood, The Elephant & Castle offers all the convenience of a Zone 1 location. Known affectionately to the locals as 'The Elephant', the area has a rich history stretching back to medieval timesâ¦and so much more to offer residents, visitors, and investors, etc, alike.   Located in a prime position in the heart of (south) central London, The Elephant & Castle is an excellent transport hub, with a Mainline Train station (direct trains to Kings Cross, Luton, Gatwick Airport and Brighton), a Zone 1 Tube station, of course, and links to nearly 50 different Bus routes. Fast and frequent London Underground services connect you to the whole of London via the Northern and Bakerloo lines.   Once all the main infrastructure projects have been completed, The Elephant & Castle will become one of the first fully Internet and social media friendly residential neighbourhoods in the whole of London.   GETTING AROUND:   The property is also, approximately, 15 - 20 minutesâ walk (5 - 10 minutes by bus & 7 - 10 minutes by bike) away from the Elephant & Castle Underground and Overground Stations, with their fast connections to anywhere you can think of in London and beyond.    The property is also served by a myriad of day and night buses stopping nearby (approx. 2 minutesâ walk in either direction). They can also get you quickly to where you need to be.   There are various âpedalâ bike stations 5 â 7 mins walk away (approx), with several others all along the Walworth Road up to the Elephant & Castle station. There are many cycle routes to choose from, including the CS7.   Parking: If required, Parking Permits can be applied for through the Southwark Council website.   On Foot: FYI, Borough Market is around 25 mins away, London Bridge about 30 mins, The South Bank is approximately 40 mins away, Covent Garden and Leicester Squareâ¦ 50 mins, Euston, St. Pancras, and Kingâs Cross stationsâ¦just over an hour (each).

title: 2 Bed Flat, Boss House, SE1
description: Offering breathtaking views of the iconic Shard, this residence is a haven for those seeking a stylish and entertaining-friendly property. Presenting an exquisite two-bedroom duplex occupying the top two floors of a remarkable warehouse conversion, Boss House. Bathed in natural light, this apartment boasts exceptional living spaces, meticulously designed to maximize comfort and functionality. The development itself provides a range of desirable amenities, including the convenience of concierge services, lift access, and a communal glass observatory showcasing panoramic 360-degree views of the London skyline.Nestled in the heart of Shad Thames, this property offers seamless access to a vibrant selection of fine restaurants and bars, ensuring a vibrant lifestyle at your doorstep. London Bridge Mainline Station is within easy reach, providing excellent connectivity to various destinations.Shad Thames, located along the picturesque banks of the River Thames, exudes a rich historical ambiance and captivating character. Adjacent to the renowned Tower Bridge, this area was once home to London's largest warehouse complex, storing precious commodities such as tea, coffee, and spices. Many of these warehouses have since been transformed into exquisite residential developments, including notable names such as Boss House, The Cardamom Building, Coriander Court, and Tea Trade Wharf.Immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere of Shad Thames, where an array of bars and restaurants await within walking distance. This prime location offers excellent accessibility, with residents enjoying leisurely walks across Tower Bridge into the city or utilizing the efficient transport links available. London Bridge Mainline Station provides access to underground services via the Jubilee and Northern lines, while Tower Hill offers connections via the District and Circle lines. For an alternative transport option, the River Taxi at Hays Galleria or St Katharine Docks offers a scenic and convenient means of travel.Experience the epitome of urban living in this exceptional duplex, perfectly blending contemporary style with the captivating heritage of Shad Thames.

title: 4 Bed Maisonette, Kinross House, N1
description: A fantastic four bedroom split level apartment ideally placed for the amenities of Caledonian Road, Angel and Kings Cross. Recently refurbished throughout, the accommodation comprises separate open plan kitchen/lounge, four good size bedrooms, fully fitted bathroom suite and access to a private balcony.Further benefits include ample storage, wood floors and access to a communal garden.Located within walking distance to both Caledonian Road & Barnsbury Overground and Kings Cross Underground Stations.

title: 2 Bed Flat, Rufford Street, N1
description: Key features* Stunning 2 Double Bedroom/ 2 Bathroom Duplex Flat - only available to rent as a whole property (2 bedrooms)* Gated Mews Development Setting* Heart Of King's Cross Location* Luxury Accommodation With Stylish Interiors* Private Balcony* Superb Open Plan Reception/Kitchen/Diner* Contemporary Bathroom And Master En-Suite* Off Street Parking* Moments From Transport Links And Vibrant AmenitiesStunning two double bedroom, two bathroom, luxury duplex apartment with a parking space directly outside its own private entrance, enviably situated within a gated mews in the heart of King's Cross, moments from fashionable Granary Square and Coal Drops Yard. The property has been superbly decorated and furnished, offering bright and spacious accommodation over two floors, with stylish interiors and a high spec finish throughout. Features include an impressive open plan reception/kitchen and newly fitted breakfast bar area, private balcony, master bedroom with dressing area and en-suite, contemporary style family bathroom, newly installed balcony doors, double glazing and electric vehicle charger. Rufford Mews is a quiet gated cul-de-sac, a few minutes walk from the ever-evolving Kings Cross, Granary Square & Coal Drops Yard. This vibrant location provides a multitude of shops and amenities and an array of fashionable bars, restaurants and cafes. Also home to the brand new headquarters for Google, Facebook, YouTube, The Guardian & Central Saint Martin's. Barnsbury Conservation Area is just as close which is one of the most revered locations in Islington, traditional gastro pubs along with some more cutting edge offerings closer to Upper Street. It is this mix of traditional English charm on the doorstep of the bustle and international flavours of Kings Cross which lend the area much of its appeal. Kings Cross St Pancras Underground is 0.6miles away (served by six underground lines, Thameslink and the Eurostar connecting you to local, national & international destinations). In addition Caledonian Road & Barnsbury Station is 0.4miles away (Overground Line) offering excellent connections to the City and the West End. There is also a nearby canal towpath providing a beautiful cycle route West to Regents Park and East to Hoxton.Square Footage: 1,193 sq ftCouncil tax: Islington Council, band E

title: 2 Bed Penthouse, Leonard Street, EC2A
description: Key Points Becoming available November 2023. Fantastic location Minutes walk from the centre of the City of London, from Liverpool St Station, from Old St underground Located in Central Shoreditch - currently home to 7 of the UKâs top 100 restaurants - and endless more restaurants, bars, cafes and clubs, Brick Lane and Spitalfields Countless art, music and cultural events in the neighbourhood Overlooking wonderful old yellow London brick warehouses Property Description A huge 90m2 2-bed, 2 bathroom, with a massive reception room, flooded with daylight from windows running the length of the property. The full-length balcony overlooks the vibrant Leonard Street (inside Congestion Zone). This Penthouse is one of only 6 residential units in the building which stands on a former wartime bomb-site. It is absolutely centrally located to modern London and the area that has been at the heart of the East End revival: much of modern British Art (like it or not) and part of Hoxton ( so hip it hurts!). Located in the Creative area, minutes walk from the financial district,  it is an unbeatable location but the (relatively) small size of the block keeps it in contact with the vibrant surrounding streets. It is rented directly by the Landlord who lived in the building for 15 years (so no agent fees, no agent bull) Located on 4th Floor, with no lifts, the stairs ensure you are kept fit. To paraphase Samuel Johnson in 1777 "When a man is tired of Shoreditch he is tired of Life.... for there is in Shoreditch, all that life can afford."

title: 4 Bed Terraced House, Gifford Street, N1
description: A beautiful architecturally designed, artists 4 story house, with a garden and terrace, situated in a rare quiet cul-de- sac. Overlooking a forest. Next to the new Kings Cross development with 100's of shops and restaurants. An Eco swimming pool and close to Kings Cross station, an ideal location to explore London.Only an 8-minute walk from Kings Cross Station, you can explore the city whilst feeling at right at home.More informationThe spaceThe kitchen spans the footprint of the house, with a sitting room dining area and toilet on the same level. A cream titled floor spans the whole floor, the kitchen with a stainless steel top opens out onto a walled very quiet garden.Two double bedrooms occupy the ground floor. There is a partition wall that can be taken down to open up the room with a sliding door if you wanted to use it as one very large bedroom with its own seating area as a 3 bedroom house. One bedroom on the first floor. A roomy bathroom overlooking the forest with a bathtub and shower, a sink set in Portland stone and toilet. The top floor room fills the span of the house with a small terrace with views over the forest. The house has recently had a new roof. Long-term lets to a family or 4 individuals preferred.

title: 2 Bed Flat, Broadfield Lane, NW1
description: An enviable 840 sq ft penthouse; comprising two spacious double bedrooms, two-bathroom, real wood floors throughout, ample storage and two expansive south and north facing terraces with breath-taking panoramas of the city.A beautifully crafted south facing open plan modern living space, leading directly to one of the two large terraces revealing superlative views of Kings Cross, St Pancras, Canary Wharf, St Pauls and the City.The large master suite features an en-suite shower room and a large inbuilt wardrobe, there is a further 4-piece family bathroom to serve second bedroom and rest of the apartment. Both bedrooms have direct access to a terrace so tenants can enjoy sunshine throughout the day.The Interior features high quality fixtures, fittings and materials throughout. Chic, clever lighting and carefully curated, stylish finishes give a minimalist yet cosy feel.Great care has been taken to ensure XY is an exemplar development, with buildings that are green and efficient, redesigned public spaces and all the facilities for a modern and sustainable lifestyle. A truly perfect embodiment of the elegance and boldness of the revitalised area.Sound proof insulation, CCTV, lift access and 24 hour Concierge service. This is an impressive & stylish development situated on the edge of King's Cross St Pancras & one of the most exciting regeneration zones in London.Kings Cross and St Pancras boasts enviable transport links to the rest of London, the UK and Paris, connecting residents with both the local area and the rest of Europe. You can be in the heart of Europe within a couple of hours courtesy of Eurostar at St Pancras International which opens up all sorts of possibilities for international travel. Paris is just over two hours away and Brussels is an even shorter hop. XY is only a short distance from central London, yet there is a busy local community in the area. Extensive transport links put numerous parks, cafes, bars, restaurants, schools, theatres, museums, shops and more within easy reach.Additional InformationThe development of the Maiden Lane estate has reinvigorate one of London's great modernist housing schemes. Built in the1970s, the estate is a significant piece of British architecture. Designed by Benson and Forsyth, it was part of a visionary master plan to create a thriving new community.XY apartments complements the classic design and brings major improvements to the public space and local areaXY is an inspired collection of 273 stylish and sustainable homes. So called for their location on the XY coordinates between King's Cross and Camden stations, the apartments are ideally located for access to two of London's most vibrant urban centres.

title: 1 Bed Flat, Vanilla And Sesame Court, SE1
description: A spacious and bright one bedroom south east facing apartment. *Now unfurnished and being re-decorated in August 2023* This property overlooks Vanilla & Sesame's charming courtyard. Presented in good condition, it is in a premium block in the heart of Shad Thames with a balcony and parking. Tenancy: The Flat will be available to move into from September 4th 2023 Viewings: We will be hosting viewings in August 2023 and we'd advise contacting us as soon as possible to book a viewing.SituationShad Thames is a desirable location along the banks of the River Thames, steeped in history and enchanting character. A variety of bars and restaurants are within walking distance. The area is very accessible and whilst many residents walk across Tower Bridge into the City, there are also good transport links via London Bridge main line train station and underground (Jubilee and Northern line) and Tower Hill (Circle and District line) - an additional transport option is the River Taxi at St Katharine Docks.

title: 1 Bed Flat, Victor Cazalet House, N1
description: Short let of a 1 double bedroom 1st floor flat with separate kitchen and sitting room superbly located in the heart of Islington. Accommodation comprises separate reception room with electric fire, kitchen, bathroom and 1 double bedroom with small built-in wardrobe and access to a balcony with views onto St Marys Church Gardens. The flat is unfurnished. Please note, this flat will be put up for sale in August. Hence, it is suitable for anyone looking to rent only for a few months until the sale goes through.The flat has been finished to a high standard throughout. A modern bathroom and kitchen (equipped with fridge/freezer, dishwasher, washing machine, microwave, hob/oven), the sitting room is dual aspect, the balcony has been fitted with weather treated decking and there is plenty of storage throughout. Located between Upper Street and Essex Road, the property affords superb access to the wide ranging amenities that Upper Street has to offer. Islington Green is moments away along with all of the bars, shops and restaurants of Upper St on your door step. Gaskin Street is superbly located for access to the transport links of Angel Station (Northern Line), Highbury & Islington (Victoria Line and Overground Network), Essex Road (National Rail) and bus routes providing access to the City, West End and all across London. Street parking is possible with a resident permit.

title: 2 Bed Flat, Kentish Town Road, NW1
description: Price is based on a 10-12 month stay for 2 people.Utility bills included.Gravity Co-Living is a fresh approach to renting in Central London thatâs fun, relaxed and lets you connect with others. Our flats are ideal spaces for students, young professionals and aspiring entrepreneurs who want to be connected to the city.We have a beautiful 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom flat with a spacious open-planned lounge and kitchen area, located just 2 minutesâ walk from Camden Town Underground Station, less than a minutesâ walk to Sainsburys supermarket and Camdenâs iconic canal.The flat has been newly refurbished and furnished to high standard with modern furniture throughout and high quality amenities in the kitchen space including fridge freezer, over/hobs and microwave. One bedroom has its private en-suite shower room, whilst the other has access to flatâs main bathroom, complete with modern fittings and bath.As a Gravity resident (weâll call you a Gravity member), youâll also have access to our Gravity app which gives you access to lots of high street discounts (amongst other things) and as we are big on community, you will be also be invited to lots of events we like to run -whether it is morning coffee sessions, yoga workshops, TED-style talks, nights out or Gravity parties.For transport, you could not be better connected. The master bedroom sits at the back of the flat and comes with a double bed, a good amount of storage space, an en-suite shower room and its own private balcony. The second bedroom features a double bed and also a good amount of storage space.As a Gravity resident (weâll call you a Gravity member), youâll also have access to our Gravity app which gives you access to lots of high street discounts (amongst other things) and as we are big on community, you will be also be invited to lots of events we like to run -whether it is morning coffee sessions, yoga workshops, TED-style talks, nights out or Gravity parties.For transport, you could not be better connected. Not only will you be a 2 minute walk from Camden Town Underground Station (Northern Line), you are also surrounded by bus stops and are just a short five minute walk from Camden Road Overground Station. For shops, bars, restaurants, nightlife and activities, youâll be living in one of Londonâs most exciting places. Camden is one of the most vibrant places in the capital.Bustling with energy and culture, Gravity Camden Town is a short walk from the famous Camden Market and the shops, bars, cafes and restaurants that surround it. Camden Lock where youâll find one of Londonâs most central canals is also just short two minute walk from the property. Other popular London hotspots such as Soho, Oxford Street and Piccadilly Circus can all be accessed by tube in around 10 minutes.Please note, some furnishings shown in images are not included and are for marketing purposes only.Price stated on ads is based on 10 month minimum stay. title: 3 Bed Flat, Wenlock Court (Off Everlyn Walk), N1
description: A cool and stylish 3 bed 1950s maisonette located between Old Street tube station (7 min walk), Hoxton Square (4 min walk), Shoreditch Park (2mis walk) & Angel (15 min walk).The property is light & airy and has been tastefully refurbished throughout with a good size kitchen (with washer/dryer, Fridge freezer, oven/hob), central heating, double glazing throughout, very large lounge (with open fire) leading out through the French doors into  an 8m x 5m garden with decking/patio & shed.On the ground floor there is also a storage cupboard under the stairs a W/c and small garden at the front. Whilst up the stairs there is a new bath/ shower and 3 bedrooms. 2 of the bedrooms are large doubles & the 3rd is a small double or good size single. There is one good sized bathroom with a separate WC downstairs. Boiler 2 years old and managed on British Gas warranty agreement.The property comes furnished & has been managed and maintained by a professional landlord for the last 20 years.Lease term is 1 year5 weeks deposit requiredReferences required.Please contact.NO AGENTS UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: 3 Bed Flat, Hucknall Court, NW8
description: HEATING INCLUDED!A bright and sunny 2nd floor flat located between Little Venice and Regent's Park â available from 22nd July 2022!Separate spacious kitchen with fridge-freezer, washing machine, dryer, oven, hob and breakfast bar.There are two large small bright double bedrooms, furnished with new double wardrobes, a chest of drawers and some storage space in the corridor. The third bedroom is smaller but still has space for a comfortable double bed and a wardrobe. Bright comfortable and spacious lounge with sofa.The newly refurbished bathroom has a toilet and shower, and there is also a second WC. Underground connections: 10 min walk to Warwick Avenue station (Bakerloo Line) 12 min walk from St. Johnâs Wood Station, Edgware Road Station and Paddington Station - very well connected to both East and West London.The flat is just 10 minutes away on foot from the beautiful Regents Park and just a couple of minutes to walk to Little Venice with its picturesque canals. Regent's Canal is accessible by crossing Lisson Grove at the back of the estate and will lead you straight into Regent's Park. There is a quaint high street(The Clifton Road) just around the corner, with local shops (Raoul's Deli,Raoul's Restaurant, an organic butcher, greengrocer, wine shop, dry cleaning and hair salons). Besides these, there is also a Sushi Restaurant, a Cafe Nero,many pubs, and a Tesco Express). Just minutes from the flat you will find a great independent coffee shop serving amazing Monmouth coffee.A 15-minute walk through little Venice will get you to Sheldon Square which offers access to Nuffield Health Club as well as employers such as Microsoft, Cognizant, Equinor, Visa and Vodaphone.Cost guidance:The rent includes Central Heating and Hot Water (Water rates, internet, Council tax and and electricity are payable separately by the tenant). The front door is secure with access via a key fob, with an intercom system in place for letting in visitors. Please note access is via stairs and there is no lift. Brand new secure windows throughoutNo admin fees. You will be renting from a private landlord.

Further adding to the property's allure are the additional two bedrooms, one furnished with a king-sized bed and a walk-in closet, the other offering a convertible bed, perfectly accommodating a large family or visiting guests. One of the standout features of this flat is the voluminous storage space, ensuring all your belongings have a dedicated spot.The NeighbourhoodOld Court Place, where the flat is located, offers the best of both worlds - peaceful yet, vibrant. description: Features and description - Partially / fully Furnished - Please note that furniture is different from the one in the pictures below - No Agent Fees - Students Can Enquire- Visits possible from the 25th July  This beautiful 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment in a new and well maintained development situated in the area of Whitechapel just 5 minutes walk from the local cafes and restaurants. The property is also just 400 metres from Bethnal Green Overground Station, 700 metres from Whitechapel Tube Station (Elizabeth line to the city, west London and Canary Wharf) and 1km to Shoreditch High Street overground station.  Located on the sixth floor with lifts. This lovely Central London apartment has a spacious living room with an semi separate kitchen and a dining area. There are 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom. The Principal bedroom has fitted wardrobes and the second bedroom is currently used as an office, and could fit a single bed. This property also benefits from a 13 meters long balcony can be accessed from the living room and the main bedroom plus a communal rooftop garden with spectacular view across London!  Situated just 400 metres from Bethnal Green Overground Station and 700 metres from Whitechapel Tube Station, you can access the Overground, Hammersmith & City, Elizabeth Line and District Line, allowing easy and quick access all over London. With the newly opened Elizabeth Line, Liverpool Street, Farringdon and Canary Wharf can be easily reached. The City is about 20 minutes walk away. From this location, you can easily access Heathrow Airport and London City Airport too.  Closer to home, you can enjoy the popular Columbia Road flower market, Brick Lane, Shoreditch and the Whitechapel Gallery, and a host of independent boutiques, cafes and delis.  Summary & Exclusions: - Rent Amount: Â£2,400.00 per month  - Deposit / Bond: Â£2,769 - 2 Bedrooms - 1 Bathroom - Property comes partially/fully furnished - Available to move in from 1 August, 2023 - Minimum tenancy term is 12 months - Maximum number of tenants is 3 - Students welcome to enquire - No Pets, sorry - No Smokers - Family Friendly - Bills not included - No Parking Available - EPC Rating: B

title: 1 Bed Flat, Latchmere Road, SW11
description: Welcome to this charming and elegant one-bedroom apartment in the heart of Battersea, located in a unique and exclusive development with private access from the street. Situated near the picturesque Battersea Park, the vibrant Clapham Junction, the iconic Albert Bridge, and the fashionable Chelsea, this residence offers a prime location in a beautiful residential area. Upon stepping into the apartment, you are greeted with an abundance of natural light streaming through large windows, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. The spacious living area is thoughtfully designed, providing ample room for relaxation and entertaining guests. The modern and stylish interior decor complements the apartment's contemporary feel, offering a perfect blend of comfort and sophistication. The bedroom is a peaceful sanctuary, exuding tranquility and comfort, allowing you to unwind and escape the hustle and bustle of city life. It offers a cozy retreat with ample storage space and a relaxing ambiance that ensures a restful night's sleep. The kitchen boasts state-of-the-art appliances and ample counter space, making it a delight for culinary enthusiasts, complete with newly fitted cabinets and dishwasher. What sets this apartment apart is the exclusive development, ensuring privacy and security. With a private entrance from the street, you'll feel like you're entering your own oasis in the heart of the city. The location of this apartment is ideal for those seeking the best of both worlds. While it offers a peaceful and picturesque residential area, it also boasts excellent local amenities. From charming cafes and trendy restaurants to boutique shops and convenient grocery stores, everything you need is just a stone's throw away. For nature lovers and fitness enthusiasts, the proximity to Battersea Park is a true highlight. A perfect escape for a leisurely stroll, a morning jog, or a relaxing picnic on sunny days, the park offers an oasis of greenery and tranquility right at your doorstep. With easy access to Clapham Junction, you can effortlessly connect to various parts of London, making it convenient for work and leisure. The iconic Albert Bridge and the vibrant neighborhood of Chelsea are just a short distance away, adding to the allure of this fantastic location. In summary, this one-bedroom apartment in Battersea offers a unique blend of elegance, comfort, and convenience. With private access from the street, proximity to beautiful parks, excellent local amenities, and well-connected transport links, it presents a truly desirable living experience in one of London's most sought-after areas.

title: 3 Bed Maisonette, Grove Lane, SE5
description: Large private roof terrace with fantastic 360 degree views of London. Rent includes heating and hot water â a huge saving and no gas bill worries. Includes super high speed gigabit optical fibre internet (1,000MB/s upload and download) with strong WiFi everywhere in the flat. A super high speed gigabit (1000MB/s) optical fibre DSL internet is included in the advertised rent. Sharers very welcome - up to 4 people. Two full bathrooms (one shared, one en suite), plus WC downstairs. Excellent transport links from Denmark Hill Station â direct services to Blackfriars, City Thameslink, Farringdon, St Pancras, Clapham High Street, Clapham Junction, London Bridge, Canada Water etc and on. Available from 3rd October. The Flat  A spacious three bedroom maisonette with roof terrace, occupying the first and second floors of a period-style building adjacent to Camberwell Hall, on Grove Lane in Camberwell.  Fully equipped chefâs kitchen with lots of counter space, breakfast bar and a waste disposer sink. There is plenty of storage space in the cupboards, and all appliances are integrated - including a dishwasher. Master bedroom has additional walk-in storage space, and en suite bathroom, making it suitable for a couple. Additional entrance area with coat/shoe storage, WC, and utility room. Designer touches throughout including curved windows and decorative elements, and high quality fittings in the bathrooms. Solid oak floors throughout. Additional Information Offered furnished/ unfurnished. The rent includes the cost of super high speed gigabit (1,000MB/s) optical fibre DSL Internet; heating, and hot water.There are no other fees or charges are associated with this service. We look after the flat with our own in-house locally based maintenance and management team. Students accepted with guarantor. A security deposit of five weeksâ rent is needed for this property. Even faster wired internet available in addition to WiFi. The WiFi, with mesh roaming, extends outside with an external booster for the roof terrace. Underfloor heating with fully independent WiFi controlled heating settings for all rooms. Transport The nearest station, Denmark Hill, is 6 minutes walk away. Regular Southern and London Overground services run from this station, with short journey times to major areas of London, including:London Victoria in 11 minutesBlackfriars in 12 minutes Canada Water in 12 minutes Shoreditch High Street in 22 minutes Clapham High Street in 5 minutes Peckham Rye in 2 minutes  In addition, regular bus services run towards Kennington / Vauxhall / Victoria / Elephant and Castle/ Liverpool Street / Waterloo / Dulwich / Forest Hill Local Area Camberwell is an exciting area to live in, with many small independent restaurants, and plenty of pubs. All tastes are catered for, whether you want to grab a quick bite from Falafel and Shawarma, small plates at Nandine or Good Neighbour, Sourdough Pizza from Theoâs, or sushi and Katsu Curry from Momo. If youâre feeling thirsty, the Grove and Crooked Well are within two minutes of the flat. Otherwise, you can grab a pint and watch the game at the Joiners, sample craft beers at Stormbird, or peruse the wines at Veraison. Regular events are held at the Tiger, including DJs and Karaoke if you want to stay out later. On a more chill note, a yoga studio, Zen Yoga, can be found next to the Butterfly Tennis Club, two minutes from the flat. The green itself hosts a range of activities including a regular farmers market, and the annual Camberwell Arts Festival. For the day to day essentials, Camberwell has your daily shopping needs covered, with a Co-Op, Tesco, Lidl, and a large Morrisonâs, as well as a handful of independent grocery shops.

title: 2 Bed Flat, St. James Court, E2
description: An opportunity to live in a unique and historic East London church conversion. The building is the church after which Redchurch Street was originally named, and while consecrated held the wedding ceremony of Reggie Kray, one of the East End's most notorious gangsters. This spacious, light and airy third floor flat has stacks of history and charm, with neogothic arches running through the flat and antique furniture to complement the historic feel of the property.  Both bedrooms are good-sized, furnished doubles. The flat boasts a modern kitchen with Bosch and Smeg appliances, a kooky bathroom, separate dining room with church pews and antique furniture and a light-drenched living room with original ecclesiastical stonework around the windows to relax in.The surrounding area is one of London's trendiest, with some of the capital's best restaurants, bars and pubs within walking distance. Columbia Road flower market is less than a ten minute walk, with Victoria Park also within easy reach. Transport links from Bethnal Green, Shoreditch High Street and local buses get you into the City and the West End in 15-30 minutes depending on your destination. title: 3 Bed Flat, Marlborough Court, W8
description: This immaculate three-bedroom apartment is conveniently located in a portered mansion block in Kensington. It has been recently renovated so that it now combines an excellent use of space with an exuberance of materials and colour.The apartment is situated on the fourth floor of Marlborough Court, a handsome red-brick 1930's mansion block, and is accessed via lift or stairs.The apartment comprises 1,100 square feet of light-filled interiors. Walnut hardwood flooring extends throughout, providing a natural grounding to the bold coloured walls. The internal doors â which are predominantly sliding pocket doors â are all full-height, contributing to the overall sense of volume.The double reception area is fitted with Lutron lighting and occupies a three-bay window frontage, where double glazed windows flood the room with morning and afternoon light. The bespoke kitchen is fitted with Smeg appliances and is partially open to the living and dining space. A quartz worktop is set against hague blue cabinets and matching quartz splashback appears to extend the room beyond its generous limits.Three bedrooms are spread along the southern aspect. There are two similarly sized double bedrooms both with built-in wardrobes. The main bedroom incorporates built-in floor to ceiling hand-painted wardrobes matching the colour of the walls.The apartment benefits from a large, private, communal garden to the rear of the property. There is a porter service 7 days a week and a gymnasium within the building.Marlborough Court is situated on Pembroke Road south of Kensington High Street, well placed for the restaurants, shops and transport links of both Kensington and Earls Court (Piccadilly, Circle & District lines) and open spaces of Holland Park. The Rent is inclusive of Heating, Hot Water and Wifi.

title: 2 Bed Flat, Southwark Park Road, SE16
description: Viewings June 25th & 26th onlyAvailable August 6thKey Features: Elegant 2-Bedroom, 2.5-Bathroom Duplex overlooking Southwark ParkPart of a modern building~70 sq.m. of refined contemporary living space Balcony with stunning park viewsGerman-designed kitchenFully Furnished. Located within a short walk of Canada Water and Bermondsey Tube Stations.This duplex apartment presents a unique chance to rent a fantastic 2-bedroom unit in a recently finished high-end development, boasting direct and unobstructed views of the lush Southwark Park. Exceptional transport links are merely minutes away, enhancing the convenience of this prime location. The apartment's design is aesthetically pleasing and bathed in ample natural light, courtesy of expansive floor-to-ceiling windows.On the lower level, you'll find a modern, fully equipped kitchen and a comfortable living room area that directly opens onto a private outdoor terrace. Here, you can sit and enjoy the park's serene ambiance with loved ones - an oasis of calm amidst the city's hustle and bustle.The kitchen, with its German engineering, includes integrated appliances like a dishwasher, oven, microwave, washer/dryer, a full-sized fridge/freezer, and a spacious hob. Plenty of storage space is available in the under-stair cupboards, while a conveniently located downstairs toilet ensures your guests' comfort.The upper level features two sun-drenched double bedrooms, each outfitted with large built-in wardrobes, and two fully tiled bathrooms (including an en-suite and a generously sized bathtub). The apartment benefits from double-glazed windows, gas central heating, superior thermal and sound insulation, solid wood flooring on the ground floor, and neutral carpets on the stairs and bedrooms.Building amenities include secure bike storage and convenient access to free parking nearby.Specifications:German-designed kitchen with Siemens appliancesFully fitted tiled bathroomsGas central heatingExceptional EPC performanceVideo IntercomWooden flooring in the living areaLocation:Just a few minutes away from Canada Water and Bermondsey Tube Stations, the development is ideally positioned for commuting to Central London - one stop to London Bridge or Canary Wharf, and less than 10 minutes by tube to the West End. You'll be merely 0.6 miles from the Thames and less than a mile from Shad Thames, close to Rotherhithe Village, and a leisurely stroll from Seven Island Leisure Centre (with a gym and large swimming pool) and the expansive Surrey Quays Shopping Centre. For your daily needs, convenience shops are conveniently located along Southwark Park Road.

Ideally situated 5 minutes walk from Brixton (24 hr Victoria line) and 7 minutes from Clapham North (northern line) underground stations. This spacious house (1550 Sq ft) has many original period features including high ceilings, wooden floorboards, fireplaces & sash windows.The property consists of a spacious double reception room with feature fireplace. There is a large modern kitchen with range cooker, American style fridge freezer and new Worster-Bosch boiler. There are 2 bathrooms; a family-size bathroom with cast iron roll-top bath and newly installed large shower cubicle and a second shower room with a toilet. There is also a further WC.There are 2 large double bedrooms with feature fireplaces and 3 further good-sized double bedrooms.Outside there is a private courtyard garden and a bike shelter with secure rails at the front of the property.The property also has a useful large cellar. Available to rent to a family or up to 5 professional sharers. This property is available from 12th August. Prior to tenants moving in the house will be professionally redecorated throughout.

title: 2 Bed Maisonette, Riverside Mansions, E1W
description: Property featuresÂ·       Spacious and peaceful two bedroom, 2 level ground floor maisonetteÂ·       Fully furnished reception and dining room with door leading to communal gardensÂ·       Separate kitchen with modern appliances Â·       Good sized master bedroom with fitted wardrobesÂ·       Bright double second bedroom with fitted wardrobeÂ·       Brand new modern bathroom with large bath and separate showerÂ·       Access to communal gym and gardens and dedicated parking bayÂ·       Fast fibre Internet available via Hyperoptic Property description  This delightful two-bedroom maisonette offers a convenient location that caters to both City professionals and Canary Wharf commuters. description: Rent this 2 bedroom Victorian conversion apartment. You are also across the road from Cambridge Heath overground station with direct links to Liverpool Street as well as an 8 minute walk to Bethnal Green station (central line). This is a unique pub conversion, split-level flat, with many retained period features. We also recently refurbished the kitchen and downstairs shower room. The living space is very generous compared to a lot of London flats, there is a large living room with comfy corner sofa, dining space and desk/study area. The kitchen is separate and also huge with space to dine (we currently have a second sofa in there as there is a breakfast bar also)There are 2 good sized double bedrooms, one is larger than the other with a king size bed and built in wardrobes. The other is a little smaller, but still has a double bed, wardrobe, room for drawers and dual aspect windows so it is nice and bright. What makes this bedroom special is your own mezzanine storage area accessed by a little flight of stairs. There is also an attic room, currently we use this as storage but it has been used as a spare room in the past as well as a snug and meditation space. The ceilings are low, you can't stand up in it but it's a useful extra space that you can use how you would like. Lastly, there is a gorgeous bathroom with roll-top bath and a newly fitted skylight and a little separate cloakroom.Please note Bills are not included in the price of the apartment.
